intro: Chaetospora calostachys, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that often appear in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and agricultural contexts.
